title: Ramon.Space raises $26 million from Foxconn and other backers
summary: Ramon.Space has raised $26 million from Ingrasys, a subsidiary of Foxconn Technology Group, the Abu Dhabi-based Strategic Development Fund, and venture capital firms.

title: Sierra Space describes long-term plans for Dream Chaser and inflatable modules
summary: WASHINGTON — As Sierra Space continues to prepare for the first flight of its Dream Chaser vehicle, it is outlining long-term ambitions for both that vehicle and space station modules. […]

title: SpaceForest Launch Test Flight of Suborbital Perun Vehicle
summary:
Polish space tech company SpaceForest has confirmed that it performed a test flight of its suborbital Perun launch system on 21 June. The rocket was launched from the Polish Air Force Central Training Ground in Ustka. The flight had initially been planned for June 19 but was postponed due to adverse weather conditions. On June […]
The post SpaceForest Launch Test Flight of Suborbital Perun Vehicle appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: SES wins $134 million DoD contract for X-band satellite communications
summary: SES Space & Defense announced June 28 it won a five-year contract worth up to $134 million to provide X-band satellite communications services to DoD.

title: ULA’s Vulcan Upper Stage Needs Mods Before First Launch
summary: The first launch of the United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket will be further delayed because the Centaur V upper stage needs modifications. ULA had targeted May 4 for that inaugural […]

title: British startup powers up sensor for monitoring tiny orbital debris
summary: Odin Space is preparing to start detecting tiny but potentially dangerous pieces of orbital debris in the coming weeks from a sensor on a recently launched space tug, according to the British startup’s cofounder and CEO James New.

title: Chinese company plans to launch rocket comparable to Falcon 9 in 2024
summary: Chinese rocket firm Space Pioneer is planning to launch a rocket comparable to the SpaceX Falcon 9 next year.

title: Artemis 2's Heat Shield is installed on Orion
summary: Artemis 2's heat shield has been installed on the Orion Spacecraft

title: PLD Space postpones first launch to September
summary: Spanish launch vehicle startup PLD Space has postponed a suborbital test flight to September after weather and a technical glitch scrubbed earlier launch attempts.

title: House appropriators target Space Force programs
summary: The House Appropriations Committee recommends nearly $1 billion in cuts from the U.S. Space Force’s $30 billion request.
